info.title: customproviders
info.description: Allows extension of ARM control plane with custom resource providers.

get.description: The list of operations provided by Microsoft CustomProviders.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

200.description: Describe the result of a successful operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all the custom resource providers within a subscription.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of custom resource providers.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all the custom resource providers within a resource group.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of custom resource providers.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the custom resource provider manifest.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceProviderName
parameters.description: The name of the resource provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

200.description: OK response definition with the existing resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates the custom resource provider.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceProviderName
parameters.description: The name of the resource provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

requestBody.description: The parameters required to create or update a custom resource provider definition.

200.description: OK response definition. Resource already exists and the changes have been accepted

201.description: Created response definition. Resource has been created

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceProviderName
parameters.description: The name of the resource provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

202.description: OK resource delete has been accepted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates an existing custom resource provider. The only value that can be updated via PATCH currently is the tags.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceProviderName
parameters.description: The name of the resource provider.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

requestBody.description: The updatable fields of a custom resource provider.

200.description: OK response. The resource has been updated.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all association for the given scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the association.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

200.description: OK. Returns all associations for the given scope.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the association.

parameters.name: associationName
parameters.description: The name of the association.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the association. The scope can be any valid REST resource instance. For example, use '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/{vm-name}' for a virtual machine resource.

parameters.name: associationName
parameters.description: The name of the association.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

requestBody.description: The parameters required to create or update an association.

200.description: OK. Association already exists and the changes have been accepted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the association.

parameters.name: associationName
parameters.description: The name of the association.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

202.description: Accepted. Association delete has been accepted.

204.description: No Content. Association was not found.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the association.

targetResourceId.description: The REST resource instance of the target resource for this association.

Association.description: The resource definition of this association.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

routingType.description: The routing types that are supported for action requests.

CustomRPActionRouteDefinition.description: The route definition for an action implemented by the custom resource provider.

actions.description: A list of actions that the custom resource provider implements.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource provider.

resourceTypes.description: A list of resource types that the custom resource provider implements.

validations.description: A list of validations to run on the custom resource provider's requests.

properties.description: The manifest for the custom resource provider

CustomRPManifest.description: A manifest file that defines the custom resource provider resources.

routingType.description: The routing types that are supported for resource requests.

CustomRPResourceTypeRouteDefinition.description: The route definition for a resource implemented by the custom resource provider.

endpoint.description: The route definition endpoint URI that the custom resource provider will proxy requests to. This can be in the form of a flat URI (e.g. 'https://testendpoint/') or can specify to route via a path (e.g. 'https://testendpoint/{requestPath}')

name.description: The name of the route definition. This becomes the name for the ARM extension (e.g. '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.CustomProviders/resourceProviders/{resourceProviderName}/{name}')

CustomRPRouteDefinition.description: A route definition that defines an action or resource that can be interacted with through the custom resource provider.

specification.description: A link to the validation specification. The specification must be hosted on raw.githubusercontent.com.

validationType.description: The type of validation to run against a matching request.

CustomRPValidations.description: A validation to apply on custom resource provider requests.

code.description: Service specific error code which serves as the substatus for the HTTP error code.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

value.description: The array of custom resource provider manifests.

operation.description: Type of operation: get, read, delete, etc.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed.

display.description: Display metadata associated with the operation.

ResourceProviderOperation.description: Supported operations of this resource provider.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

value.description: List of operations supported by this resource provider.

ResourceProviderOperationList.description: Results of the request to list operations.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group.

ResourceProviderNameParameter.name: resourceProviderName
ResourceProviderNameParameter.description: The name of the resource provider.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The Azure subscription ID. This is a GUID-formatted string (e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)
